conclusion: Ideal gas process moves from state A to state B and then to state C.
Diagram shows pressure on y-axis in units of 10³ Pa and volume on x-axis in units of 10⁻³ m³.
Point A is at (1, 3) × 10³ Pa, 10⁻³ m³.
Point B is at (2, 2) × 10³ Pa, 10⁻³ m³.
Point C is at (3, 2) × 10³ Pa, 10⁻³ m³.
Red horizontal line connecting points B and C indicates an isobaric process.
For an isobaric process, work done is given by W = p ⋅ ΔV.
Pressure remains constant at p = 2 × 10³ Pa from point B to point C.
Initial volume at B is V_B = 2 × 10⁻³ m³.
Final volume at C is V_C = 3 × 10⁻³ m³.
Change in volume ΔV = V_C - V_B = 1 × 10⁻³ m³.
Calculate work: W = (2 × 10³ Pa) × (1 × 10⁻³ m³) = 2 J.
Since volume increases, work is done by the gas on the surroundings, so work has a positive sign.
The work done externally by the gas from state B to state C is 2 J.
